attributes.action: Local authorities to provide Child Performance Licence in shorter time scales
attributes.additional_details:
For a child to be confirmed on a role is a big achievement after going through long processes of auditions, recalls and doing their best to impress Casting Directors, Producers and Directors. 

This then leads to obtaining a child performance licence from the LEA in order for them to perform on the productions. 

Within the industry, bookings can be last minute and require a fast licence turnaround. When this does not happen, children are disappointed and disheartened.

Please change the process
attributes.background: It is already difficult for children to get an audition through to being offered a role. We would like the Local Council to support by providing performance licences tailored to the production timescales. This would help avoid disappointing children and letting them down.

rejection.details:
At the moment, this is the responsibility of your local council. 

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You could start a new petition calling on Parliament to set a legal maximum time for local councils to respond to requests for Child Performance Licences, if that's what you'd like to happen.
